file_content.text: You have completed the trials. Move on.
Look to the tablets. The vision is yours.
You are worthy. The shrine is open to you.
Stop here, outsiders.
Outsider. We are impressed.
The trials are for the Mystics. Yet you survive.
Sith are often tested through combat.
Your tests are familiar.
A Mystic must be prepared.
When it comes to mind games, I'm something of an expert.
I live for your trials.
Not all battles are fought with words.
You seem to want people to fail.
It sure wasn't easy.
Only the undeserving.
All the answers are in Voss culture.
I pay close attention.
Knowledge is nothing without skill.
Does this mean the trials are over?
And have I passed?
One trial remains.
I'm better than a Mystic.
There is time yet to fail.
Visions show our fortunes. Survival depends on a Mystic's sight.
A Mystic protects the Voss. He must know our enemy.
Save the Mystic philosophy. Just show me what to kill.
Get to the point.
You assume it can be killed.
You mean the teched-out natives. The Gormak.
I know your enemy.
The Gormak would destroy us. A Mystic must know how.
Any enemies of the Voss are my enemies, too.
I'll do my best.
You think as they do.
Many Voss fail the trials. Outsiders do not survive.
